page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY STANFORD 2
page.content: The present church at Stanford was built in 1769. This was a new site, as the original church and village had stood beside Stanford Court. The lake now covers the site of these buildings but sometimes when the lake is low, the foundations of the original church can be seen. When the church was rebuilt, some land was also given to the church, and this farmland is now managed by the Church Commissioners. The Winnington family still take an interest in the village, and Sir Francis Winnington is a Churchwarden. The local school, originally provided by the Winningtons, is now the Village Hall, as local children are being taken to Great Witley (3 miles away), Lindridge (4 miles) or Tenbury Wells (10 miles) for a state school education.
